page.title: 08CYCLING IN HORTON
page.content: Many boys and men in Horton enjoy motor cycling.Some of them go to motor bike scrambles.In one of our squares is a motor bike scrambling track.You cannot ride a motor bike on the road until you are sixteen and have passed a test. The younger boys and girls ride push-bikes .Several of us are taking a cycling proficiency test. We need our bikes in good order. We learn the High way code and traffic signs .When we ride on the road we have to wear tabards. Some of us have BMX bikes .BMX means Bike Motor Cross.BMX bikes have no engine .They have rubber tyres, metal frames and pads on the crossbar and on the handlebars, but no mud guards.We can do stunts on them.An ordinary bike is heavy and the wheels are too thin. James,Richard,Duncan.
